laboratory_examinations.findings: Diffuse atrophy of the left hemisphere, more prominent over the parieto-occipital region.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: A second MRI at age 13 years 2 months showed progressive atrophy of the affected hemisphere.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Left frontotemporal atrophy and T2 hypersignal.
Area of abnormal signal in the left frontal lobe that involved both the gray matter and the underlying white matter, consistent with an area of focal encephalitis.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: MRI at age 14 years showed left hemispheric atrophy.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal cell counts and normal chemical profile.
Serum ANA were measured at 1:640 dilution.
CSF cell count and chemistry were normal, although protein electrophoresis showed 2 pronounced and 2 weak immunoglobulin G oligoclonal bands.
Increased ANA were measured at a 1:640 dilution.
